entities.name: bertha jorkins
entities.description: Bertha Jorkins is mentioned as a source of information for Voldemort. She is described as having provided information that was used to manipulate the Goblet of Fire.

entities.name: harry potter
entities.description: Harry Potter is the main character and is being manipulated by Voldemort through his Death Eater. He is described as being brought to Voldemort's location using a Portkey.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is mentioned as someone who would be unable to help or protect Harry due to Voldemort's plan.

entities.name: voldemort
entities.description: Voldemort is the main antagonist and is described as using his Death Eater to manipulate the Goblet of Fire and bring Harry to him.

entities.name: goblet of fire
entities.description: The Goblet of Fire is a magical object that was manipulated by Voldemort's Death Eater to ensure Harry's participation in the tournament.

entities.name: triwizard cup
entities.description: The Triwizard Cup is a magical object that was turned into a Portkey by Voldemort's Death Eater.

entities.name: death eater
entities.description: Voldemort's Death Eaters are a group of followers who carry out his plans. They are described as being used to manipulate the Goblet of Fire and bring Harry to Voldemort.

relationships.description: Voldemort used information from Bertha Jorkins to manipulate the Goblet of Fire.
Voldemort controlled his Death Eater, who carried out his plans.
Voldemort manipulated the Goblet of Fire to ensure Harry's participation in the tournament.
Voldemort turned the Triwizard Cup into a Portkey.
The Death Eater manipulated the Goblet of Fire to ensure Harry's participation in the tournament.
Voldemort brought Harry Potter to his location using a Portkey.
Dumbledore would have protected Harry Potter from Voldemort's plan.
